title: Calories in Grilled Chicken Thigh
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken thigh grilled, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and easy tweaks for your meal.
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken thigh (~100 g), grilled without added oil or marinade.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, cut, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or use a food scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One grilled chicken thigh (skinless, ~100 g) has about 177 kcal and 24 g protein.

label_note: Values align with standard Nutrition Facts labels for quick reference and comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for grilling

faqs.q: How many calories in one grilled chicken thigh?
faqs.a: About 177 kcal for a skinless, boneless thigh (~100 g).

faqs.q: Is grilled chicken thigh high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, one thigh provides ~24 g protein with low carbs.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in grilled chicken thigh?
faqs.a: Around 8.7 g total fat, including 2.4 g saturated, per skinless thigh.

faqs.q: Does skin affect calories in grilled chicken thigh?
faqs.a: Yes, skin-on adds ~109 kcal due to higher fat content.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in grilled chicken thigh?
faqs.a: Negligibleâ€”0 g carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain grilled preparation.
